result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. VERNON F CERNEY JR

defendant.name: CERNEY, VERNON F, JR
defendant.address: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt:
9:58 AM Defendant VERNON F CERNEY JR in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for VERNON F CERNEY JR.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Nelson regarding motion to modify bond - defendant is looking into getting into treatment.  Statement by ADA McElroy - wants treatment to be set up before the defendant is released or bond is modified. Statement by the Court - will look at bond when there is more information on treatment. Court denies motion to modify bond.

Court adjourned at 10:03 PM
Motion hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return date on December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:54 PM Defendant VERNON F CERNEY JR in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for VERNON F CERNEY JR.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson states the preliminary hearing will proceed. ADA McElroy states he has one witness.  

Ryan Behlke sworn, direct by ADA McElroy. Witness is employed as a police officer for Markesan Police Department and was employed on the date in question. Venue established. Testimony given. Witness identifies the defendant in the court room. Cross by Atty Nelson. No redirect by the ADA McElroy. No further witnesses from the State. Court will take judicial notice the defendant was on bond for case 22CF125 at the time of the arrest. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. State files an information with the court and confirms it mirrors the criminal complaint. Attorney Nelson and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading and confirms it mirrors the criminal complaint. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant on all counts. Court will set for Return Date December 19, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Atty Nelson requests bond modification and states reasons. ADA McElroy objects to bond modification. Court denies request to modify bond.


Court adjourned at 2:26 PM
Return date scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:39 PM Defendant VERNON F CERNEY JR in court, in custody.  Atty Scott Nelson appears in court, with the defendant on 2022CF124 and appears as a courtesy appearance on 2022CF149. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF124 & 2022CF149. 2022CF149-Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set - $2,500 cash and condition. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. 

2022CF124 - Attorney Nelson acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 2:43 PM

Court will set 2022CF149 for Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 1:00 PM (1/2 hr).  2022CF124 is to track with.
Initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:15 PM Defendant VERNON F CERNEY JR by video, in custody. Attorney Scott Nelson appeared by video for VERNON F CERNEY.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed a probable cause statement and finds probable cause that a crime may have been committed.  ADA makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Court orders bond at $2,500.00  cash bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court sets initial appearance for September 13, 2022 at 1:15 PM.
